description: Ryu Yamada is a second year student at Suzaku High. Ryu is always late for school, naps in class and gets abysmal grades. His life is a dead bore. The beautiful Urara Shiraishi, on the other hand, is Suzaku High's brightest student. One day, without explanation, their bodies are swapped! Ryu ends up in Urara's body, and Urara in Ryu's.
synonyms: ยามาดะคุงกับแม่มดทั้ง 7

tags.name: Witch
tags.description: Prominently features a character who is a witch.

tags.name: Body Swapping
tags.description: Centers around individuals swapping bodies with one another.

tags.name: School
tags.description: Partly or completely set in a primary or secondary educational institution.

tags.name: School Club
tags.description: Partly or completely set in a school club scene.

tags.name: Amnesia
tags.description: Prominently features a character(s) with memory loss.

tags.name: Heterosexual
tags.description: Prominently features a romance between a man and a woman, not inherently sexual.

tags.name: Urban Fantasy
tags.description: Set in a world similar to the real world, but with the existence of magic or other supernatural elements.

tags.name: Love Triangle
tags.description: Centered around romantic feelings between more than two people. Includes all love polygons.

tags.name: Gender Bending
tags.description: Prominently features a character who dresses and behaves in a way characteristic of another gender, or has been transformed into a person of another gender.

tags.name: Primarily Teen Cast
tags.description: Main cast is mostly composed of teen characters.

tags.name: Shounen
tags.description: Target demographic is teenage and young adult males.

tags.name: LGBTQ+ Themes
tags.description: Prominently features characters or themes associated with the LGBTQ+ community, such as sexuality or gender identity.

tags.name: Mixed Gender Harem
tags.description: Main cast features the protagonist plus several people, regardless of gender, who are romantically interested in them.

tags.name: Episodic
tags.description: Features story arcs that are loosely tied or lack an overarching plot.

title.native: ヤンキー君な山田くんとメガネちゃんと魔女
山田くんと7人の魔女 OAD

node.description:
**Residency:** Asagaya, Tokyo, Japan

**Takuno Seiki** is a Japanese director, episode director, production manager and storyboard artist.
[Twitter](https://twitter.com/anime_usui)
**Michiko Yokote** is a Japanese scriptwriter. She is the pupil of [Kazunori Itou](https://anilist.co/staff/97941).
**Iida Eriko** is a Japanese character and prop designer, animator, animation supervisor and animation director.

[Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/鶴岡陽太)

Founder and representative director of [Rakuonsha](https://anilist.co/studio/211/).

__Graduated:__ Kunitachi College of Music (Department of Composition)

[Artist Profile (Miracle Bus)](http://miraclebus.com/composer/masaruyokoyama) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/masaruyokoyama)

**Yokoyama Masaru** is a Japanese composer, arranger, keyboardist and programmer affiliated with Miracle Bus.

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/yoshikawamiki)

Miki Yoshikawa is a Japanese manga artist. Her debut work was a one-shot called Glory Days in Kodansha's Magazine Special. She was previously [Hiro Mashima](https://anilist.co/staff/96882)'s assistant on Rave Master and Fairy Tail. In 2005, she released the comedy one-shot Flunk Punk Rumble in Shonen Magazine Wonder, which was later made into a short series and eventually publicized in Kodansha's Weekly Shounen Magazine from 2006–2011, with a total of 211 chapters. In 2012, she released Yamada-kun and the Seven Witches, which has to date sold over 3 million copies, and was adapted into a live-action drama series and a TV anime series. In 2015, Yoshikawa attended Anime Expo as a guest.

**Founded:** 2013
**Disbanded:** 2017

**[Website](http://www.mimimememimi.com/)** | **[Twitter](https://twitter.com/mimimeme_MIMI)** | **[Blog (JP)](https://ameblo.jp/takaoyuki/)** | **[YouTube](https://www.youtube.com/user/mimimemeMIMIchannel/videos)**

**Biography:**
MimimemeMIMI was a Japanese music unit which consisted of now retired voice actress (seiyuu) and vocalist/lyricist Takao Yuki (タカオユキ) and illustrator Chamooi. The duo debuted with a song titled "Sentimental Love", which was used as the opening theme song to the anime *[A Town Where You Live](https://anilist.co/anime/17741/Kimi-no-Iru-Machi/)*. The girls called themselves a "next generation audio-visual unit" and offered a unique mixture of music and imagery. The unit name, "Mimi Meme Mimi", was made under the wish that they wanted their songs to appeal to their listeners "From ears to eyes. From eyes to ears" (耳・目・目・耳 *Mimi-Me-Me-Mimi*)

**Members:**
- [Takao Yuki (タカオユキ)](https://anilist.co/staff/119709/Yuki-Takao) - vocals, lyrics
- Chamooi (ちゃもーい) - illustrations

(Source: [en.wikipedia.org](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Mimi_Meme_Mimi), edited)
**Iizuka Masanori** is a Japanese character and prop designer, animator, animation supervisor and animation director.

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/i/user/3232480742) | [Tumblr](https://gagawa62.tumblr.com/) | [Instagram](https://instagram.com/gawasan864)

Originating from [Kyoto Animation](https://anilist.co/studio/2/).

Website | Twitter | Facebook | Instagram WEAVER is a Japanese rock trio band under A-Sketch, a sub-label created by AMUSE in 2008. The trio formed in 2004 during high school in Kobe, Japan. They made their debut in 2009 with the digital single "Hakuchoumu". In 2010 they released their debut single "Hard to say I love you ~Iidasenakute~", which was used as the theme song for the drama Sunao ni Narenakute. Members: Birth Name: [杉本雄治 (Yuuji Sugimoto)](https://anilist.co/staff/154208/Yuuji-Sugimoto) Instrument(s): Vocals and Piano Main roles in the band: Lead Vocals/Pianist Birth Name: 奥野翔太 (Shota Okuno) Date of Birth: August 18, 1988 Instrument(s): Bass Main roles in the band: Playing the Bass and supporting vocals Birth Name: [河邉徹 (Tooru Kawabe)](https://anilist.co/staff/155425/Tooru-Kawabe) Date of Birth: June 28, 1988 Instrument(s): Drums Main roles in the band: Playing the Drums and supporting vocals Record Label: A-Sketch/antwork (Source: last.fm/generasia.com)

**[Twitter](https://twitter.com/editzhirose)** | **[Website](http://www.editz.jp/)**

**Hirose Kiyoshi** is a Japanese editor and film editor.
**Michiko Yokote** is a Japanese scriptwriter. She is the pupil of [Kazunori Itou](https://anilist.co/staff/97941).

**Graduated:** Waseda University

Hirasawa Nao is a Japanese publicity and production manager, producer, animation planner and animation producer. He is the founder and CEO of company [ARCH](https://archinc.jp/ja/).
**Chiba Tomohiro** is a Japanese producer and animation planner.
